title: What are disadvantages of agriculture? - Quora

response.answer_text: Uses up too much waterUses up too much landMany crops and especially meat production produces few calories per acreWater is much more necessary than food…starvation is not that dangerous whereas dehydration is very dangerous. It takes like at least 3 weeks of starvation for anything bad to happen whereas dehydration can kill in days or even hours depending on the condition so a water crisis would be more serious than a food crisis. Land is needed for houses and many other things…especially important in countries with high population densities. Meat production especially doesn’t work well, doesn’t produce many calories per acre, uses up lots of land and water.  The Shocking Truth Of Meat Consumption And Production. Everything You Need To Know Is Right Here!  The Ecological Consequences of Meat Consumption  It's STILL such a no-brainer. (Calories Per Acre.) Even very low-calorie green vegetables like celery produce more calories and use less far less water than producing beef. The negative effects of agriculture especially with meat production is important in developing countries that have high birth rates large population growth (more developed countries have low birth rates and slow population growth so everything is automatically very easy regardless of the method used to gain food/water). A proposed solution - eat insects like crickets instead  Cricket Nutrition Facts | Cricket vs. Beef Crickets use up far less land, water, and resources in general and have more protein than beef. I’m not sure how crickets taste though but probably with seasoning and stuff it might taste good.
